page.title: 12BATTLE ABBEY SCHOOL
page.content: {BATTLE ABBEY SCHOOL}IS A GIRLS' PUBLIC BOARDING AND DAY SCHOOL.THERE ARE{140 PUPILS,MOST OF WHOM ARE BOARDERS.THE SCHOOL MOVED HERE IN{1922}FROM BEXHILL WHERE IT WAS KNOWN AS ST. ETHELDREDA'S SCHOOL.IT WAS FOUNDED BY MRS. MARY JACOBY AND MISS. HELEN SHEEHAN-DARE. IN{1931}THE ABBOT'S HOUSE WAS BADLY DAMAGED BY FIRE BUT NONE OF THE GIRLS WAS HURT.THE SCHOOL MOVED OUT WHILE TWO YEARS OF RESTORATION WORK TOOK PLACE AND THEY LEFT AGAIN FROM 1939-45 FOR SAFETY REASONS.SINCE 1945 THE SCHOOL HAS GROWN AND ITS FACILITIES ARE STEADILY BEING IMPROVED.EACH GIRL BELONGS TO A{HOUSE:}ST. MARY, ST. MARTIN, ST. ETHELDREDA AND ST.PATRICK. THERE ARE HOUSE PREFECTS CALLED STARS AND SCHOOL PREFECTS CALLED BRONZES.SCHOOL UNIFORM IS COMPULSORY AND ITS COLOURS ARE BROWN AND CREAM. THE SCHOOL MOTTO IS{"FOY EST TOUT".
